commander.name: Johann von Ravenstein
commander.previous_service: Took command upon division redesignation from 5. leichte Division
commander.notes: Captured by New Zealand troops near Tobruk on 29 November 1941 during Operation Crusader. First German general to become Allied POW in WWII.

formation_history.redesignation_notes: Redesignated from 5. leichte Division on 1 August 1941. Received reinforcements from 15. Panzer-Division including Schützen-Regiment 104 (I. and II. Battalions), Kradschützen-Bataillon 15, and MG-Bataillon 8. Panzer-Regiment 5 received II. Abteilung from Panzer-Abteilung 190 (90. leichte Afrika-Division).
organizational_changes: August 1, 1941: Redesignation from 5. leichte Division to 21. Panzer-Division
Added Schützen-Regiment 104 (I., II. Battalions) from 15. Panzer-Division
Panzer-Regiment 5 received II. Abteilung from Panzer-Abteilung 190

subordinate_units.notes: II. Abteilung received from Panzer-Abteilung 190 (90. leichte Afrika-Division) during reorganization
I. and II. Battalions transferred from 15. Panzer-Division during August 1941 reorganization
Transferred from 15. Panzer-Division during August 1941 reorganization
Added during reorganization. Peacetime location: Züllichau
Retained from 5. leichte Division. Became Panzer-Aufklärungs-Abteilung 90 in 1943
Retained from 5. leichte Division (originally from 3. Panzer-Division)
Unit number not identified. Retained from 5. leichte Division

personnel_notes: Personnel estimated from standard German panzer division establishment (approximately 12,500 men). 21. Panzer-Division was formed from 5. leichte Division plus reinforcements from 15. Panzer-Division in August 1941.

1.notes: Standard German rifle. Count not extracted.

2.notes: Standard German machine gun. Count not extracted.

3.notes: Standard German submachine gun. Count not extracted.

tanks.notes: Tank strength as of November 1941 from Panzerworld. Q3 1941 strength likely higher before Operation Crusader losses. 5. leichte Division had 155 tanks in March 1941.

Panzer III.ausf: Unknown (likely mix of Ausf. E, F, G, H with 3.7cm or 5cm gun)
Panzer III.notes: 5. leichte Division had 61 Pz.III in March 1941. Losses and replacements during Q2-Q3.

Panzer IV.ausf: Unknown (likely Ausf. D or E with short 7.5cm gun)
Panzer IV.notes: Count consistent with 5. leichte Division strength in March 1941.

Panzer I.notes: 5. leichte Division had 25 Pz.I in March 1941. All retired/destroyed by November 1941.

Panzer II.notes: 5. leichte Division had 45 Pz.II in March 1941. Losses during Q2-Q3 operations.

command_tanks.notes: 5. leichte Division had 7 Panzerbefehlswagen in March 1941. Q3 1941 count not extracted.

halftracks.notes: Halftrack counts not extracted from available sources

armored_cars.notes: Armored car counts not extracted. Aufklärungs-Abteilung 3 had armored cars but specific numbers not found.

trucks.notes: Truck counts not extracted from available sources

motorcycles.notes: Motorcycle counts not extracted. Kradschützen-Bataillon 15 had motorcycles but specific numbers not found.

support_vehicles.notes: Support vehicle counts not extracted from available sources

field_artillery.notes: I./Artillerie-Regiment 75 confirmed present. Standard light artillery battalion typically has 12 guns (3 batteries × 4 guns), likely 10.5cm leFH 18. Specific counts not extracted.

anti_tank.notes: Panzerjäger-Abteilung 39 confirmed present. Likely equipped with 3.7cm PaK 35/36 and/or 5cm PaK 38. Specific counts not extracted.

anti_aircraft.notes: Anti-aircraft gun counts not extracted from available sources

aircraft_notes: No organic air assets. Luftwaffe support provided by separate formations.

supply_logistics.supply_status: Adequate but constrained - Q3 1941 period after Operation Battleaxe (June) and before Operation Crusader (November). Supply lines from Tripoli stretched across 800km. Fuel reserves marginal at 5-6 days, ammunition adequate at 10 days, water critical desert constraint at 2.5L/man/day, food reserves 12 days. British blockade and limited Axis shipping affecting resupply.

weather_environment.terrain_type: Coastal desert (Cyrenaica) - sand, gravel, rocky escarpments

tactical_doctrine.role: Mobile armored division for offensive and defensive operations in North African desert
special_capabilities: Desert warfare experience from 5. leichte Division operations
tactical_innovations: Adapted leichte (light) division organization to full panzer division structure
known_issues: Sand filter problems with tanks experienced in early 1941 (only 25 of 155 tanks operational by 11 April 1941)
tactical_doctrine.desert_adaptations: Experienced desert warfare unit with adaptations learned during 5. leichte Division operations February-July 1941

special_rules: Desert Veterans: +1 to movement in desert terrain
Commander captured 29 November 1941 (use for late-1941 scenarios)
historical_engagements: Defense against British Operation Battleaxe (June 1941 as 5. leichte)

source: Tessin Band 02: Verbände und Truppen - 5. leichte Division to 21. Panzer-Division redesignation (Tier 1, 90% confidence)
Tessin Band 05: Unit histories and subordinate formations (Tier 1, 85% confidence)
Panzerworld.com: Tank strength data November 1941 - 110 tanks total (Tier 2, 80% confidence)
Feldgrau.com: 21. Panzer-Division organizational structure and operations (Tier 2, 75% confidence)
Nafziger Collection: German Afrika Korps OOB 1941 (Tier 1, 80% confidence)
Cross-referenced: Commander Johann von Ravenstein (Keilig, multiple sources confirm)
Cross-referenced: Redesignation date 1 August 1941 (Tessin, Nafziger, Feldgrau)
Cross-referenced: Reinforcements from 15. Panzer-Division (Schützen-Rgt 104, Kradschützen-Btl 15, MG-Btl 8)
Calculated: Personnel 12,500 from standard 1941 Panzer Division KStN (added in Phase 1 upgrade)
Previous extraction: 5. leichte Division Q1 1941 baseline provides formation context
Schema v3.0: supply_logistics and weather_environment added for scenario generation
validation.validated_by: Claude Code - Phase 2 Low Confidence Upgrade

data_completeness_notes: Upgraded to 78% confidence through enhanced Tier 1-2 source integration
Tessin Band 02/05 provides authoritative organizational structure
Tank strength from Panzerworld November 1941 (110 tanks) - Q3 likely 120-140 before Crusader losses
Organizational structure confirmed: Redesignation 1 Aug 1941 from 5. leichte Division
Commander Johann von Ravenstein confirmed (served 1 Aug - 29 Nov 1941, captured)
Reinforcements from 15. Panzer-Division documented in Tessin
Personnel 12,500 estimated from standard KStN 1140d (1941 Panzer Division)
Supply logistics estimated for Q3 1941: post-Battleaxe, pre-Crusader period
Weather data reflects peak desert summer conditions (July-Sept, up to 45°C)
Baseline from 5. leichte Division Q1 1941 extraction provides continuity
Data gaps documented honestly - no speculative filling

metadata.extraction_method: Multi-source waterfall: Tessin Band 02/05/08 + Web tier 2 sources + Previous 5. leichte Division data
